revised_title: Investigating the Effects of Ultra-Violet Radiation on Involuntary Muscle and the Absence of Physiological Interference by Visible Rays
tldr: This study investigates the effects of ultra-violet radiation on involuntary muscle and whether visible rays interfere with these effects. The researchers found that visible rays had no inhibitory effect on the exciting effects of ultra-violet rays on involuntary muscle. They also discovered that the presence of calcium is necessary for the increase of muscle tone produced by ultra-violet rays.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
